verses.kjv: Ahaz was twenty years old when he began to reign, and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem: but he did not that which was right in the sight of the LORD, like David his father:
verses.web: Ahaz was twenty years old when he began to reign, and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem. He didn’t do that which was right in LORD’s eyes, like David his father,
verses.ct: Ahaz was 20 years old when he became king, and he ruled in Jerusalem for 16 years. Unlike his ancestor David, the LORD saw that he was evil.

verses.kjv: For he walked in the ways of the kings of Israel, and made also molten images for Baalim.
verses.web: but he walked in the ways of the kings of Israel, and also made molten images for the Baals.
verses.ct: He followed the ways of the kings of Israel and even made cast metal idols for the Baals.

verses.kjv: Moreover he burnt incense in the valley of the son of Hinnom, and burnt his children in the fire, after the abominations of the heathen whom the LORD had cast out before the children of Israel.
verses.web: Moreover he burned incense in the valley of the son of Hinnom, and burned his children in the fire, according to the abominations of the nations whom LORD cast out before the children of Israel.
verses.ct: He burned incense in the Valley of Ben Hinnom and sacrificed his own children in the fire — copying the disgusting practices of the nations the LORD had driven out to make room for Israel.

verses.kjv: He sacrificed also and burnt incense in the high places, and on the hills, and under every green tree.
verses.web: He sacrificed and burned incense in the high places, and on the hills, and under every green tree.
verses.ct: He also offered sacrifices and burned incense at the high places, on the hilltops, and under every spreading green tree.

verses.kjv: Wherefore the LORD his God delivered him into the hand of the king of Syria; and they smote him, and carried away a great multitude of them captives, and brought them to Damascus. And he was also delivered into the hand of the king of Israel, who smote him with a great slaughter.
verses.web: Therefore LORD his God delivered him into the hand of the king of Syria. They struck him, and carried away from him a great multitude of captives, and brought them to Damascus. He was also delivered into the hand of the king of Israel, who struck him with a great slaughter.
verses.ct: Because of all this, the LORD his God handed him over to the king of Syria. The Syrians defeated him, captured a huge number of his people, and took them to Damascus. He was also handed over to the king of Israel, who inflicted a devastating defeat on him.

verses.kjv: For Pekah the son of Remaliah slew in Judah an hundred and twenty thousand in one day, which were all valiant men; because they had forsaken the LORD God of their fathers.
verses.web: For Pekah the son of Remaliah killed in Judah one hundred twenty thousand in one day, all of them valiant men, because they had forsaken LORD, the God of their fathers.
verses.ct: Pekah son of Remaliah killed 120,000 soldiers in Judah in a single day — all of them fighting men — because the people had abandoned the LORD, the God of their ancestors.

verses.kjv: And Zichri, a mighty man of Ephraim, slew Maaseiah the king’s son, and Azrikam the governor of the house, and Elkanah that was next to the king.
verses.web: Zichri, a mighty man of Ephraim, killed Maaseiah the king’s son, Azrikam the ruler of the house, and Elkanah who was next to the king.
verses.ct: Zichri, a warrior from Ephraim, killed Maaseiah the king's son, Azrikam the palace administrator, and Elkanah, the king's second-in-command.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel carried away captive of their brethren two hundred thousand, women, sons, and daughters, and took also away much spoil from them, and brought the spoil to Samaria.
verses.web: The children of Israel carried away captive of their brothers two hundred thousand women, sons, and daughters, and also took away much plunder from them, and brought the plunder to Samaria.
verses.ct: The Israelite army also captured 200,000 of their own relatives from Judah — women, sons, and daughters — and seized a massive amount of plunder, which they brought back to Samaria.

verses.kjv: But a prophet of the LORD was there, whose name was Oded: and he went out before the host that came to Samaria, and said unto them, Behold, because the LORD God of your fathers was wroth with Judah, he hath delivered them into your hand, and ye have slain them in a rage that reacheth up unto heaven.
verses.web: But a prophet of LORD was there, whose name was Oded; and he went out to meet the army that came to Samaria, and said to them, “Behold, because LORD, the God of your fathers, was angry with Judah, he has delivered them into your hand, and you have slain them in a rage which has reached up to heaven.
verses.ct: But a prophet of the LORD named Oded was there. He went out to meet the army as it arrived in Samaria and told them, "Listen! The LORD, the God of your ancestors, was angry with Judah, so he handed them over to you. But you have slaughtered them with a fury that reaches all the way to heaven.

verses.kjv: And now ye purpose to keep under the children of Judah and Jerusalem for bondmen and bondwomen unto you: but are there not with you, even with you, sins against the LORD your God?
verses.web: Now you intend to degrade the children of Judah and Jerusalem as male and female slaves for yourselves. Aren’t there even with you trespasses of your own against LORD your God?
verses.ct: Now you plan to force the people of Judah and Jerusalem into slavery as your servants. But don't you have sins of your own against the LORD your God?

verses.kjv: Now hear me therefore, and deliver the captives again, which ye have taken captive of your brethren: for the fierce wrath of the LORD is upon you.
verses.web: Now hear me therefore, and send back the captives that you have taken captive from your brothers, for the fierce wrath of LORD is on you.”
verses.ct: Listen to me! Send these captives back — they are your own relatives! The fierce anger of the LORD is hanging over you right now."

verses.kjv: Then certain of the heads of the children of Ephraim, Azariah the son of Johanan, Berechiah the son of Meshillemoth, and Jehizkiah the son of Shallum, and Amasa the son of Hadlai, stood up against them that came from the war,
verses.web: Then some of the heads of the children of Ephraim, Azariah the son of Johanan, Berechiah the son of Meshillemoth, Jehizkiah the son of Shallum, and Amasa the son of Hadlai, stood up against those who came from the war,
verses.ct: Then 4 leaders from Ephraim — Azariah son of Johanan, Berechiah son of Meshillemoth, Jehizkiah son of Shallum, and Amasa son of Hadlai — stood up and confronted the soldiers returning from battle.

verses.kjv: And said unto them, Ye shall not bring in the captives hither: for whereas we have offended against the LORD already, ye intend to add more to our sins and to our trespass: for our trespass is great, and there is fierce wrath against Israel.
verses.web: and said to them, “You must not bring in the captives here, for you intend that which will bring on us a trespass against LORD, to add to our sins and to our guilt; for our guilt is great, and there is fierce wrath against Israel.”
verses.ct: They said, "You must not bring those captives here! What you're planning will pile even more sin and guilt on top of what we already carry. Our guilt is enormous, and the LORD's fierce anger already burns against Israel."

verses.kjv: So the armed men left the captives and the spoil before the princes and all the congregation.
verses.web: So the armed men left the captives and the plunder before the princes and all the assembly.
verses.ct: So the soldiers released the captives and handed over the plunder in front of the leaders and the entire assembly.

verses.kjv: And the men which were expressed by name rose up, and took the captives, and with the spoil clothed all that were naked among them, and arrayed them, and shod them, and gave them to eat and to drink, and anointed them, and carried all the feeble of them upon asses, and brought them to Jericho, the city of palm trees, to their brethren: then they returned to Samaria.
verses.web: The men who have been mentioned by name rose up and took the captives, and with the plunder clothed all who were naked among them, dressed them, gave them sandals, and gave them something to eat and to drink, anointed them, carried all the feeble of them on donkeys, and brought them to Jericho, the city of palm trees, to their brothers. Then they returned to Samaria.
verses.ct: The men who had been chosen by name stepped forward and took charge of the captives. From the plunder they clothed everyone who was naked, gave them clothes and sandals, fed them, gave them something to drink, and rubbed oil on their wounds. They put all the weak ones on donkeys and brought them to their relatives in Jericho, the city of palm trees. Then they returned to Samaria.

verses.kjv: At that time did king Ahaz send unto the kings of Assyria to help him.
verses.web: At that time king Ahaz sent to the kings of Assyria to help him.
verses.ct: Around that same time, King Ahaz sent a message to the kings of Assyria asking for help.

verses.kjv: For again the Edomites had come and smitten Judah, and carried away captives.
verses.web: For again the Edomites had come and struck Judah, and carried away captives.
verses.ct: The Edomites had attacked Judah again, defeating them and carrying off prisoners.

verses.kjv: The Philistines also had invaded the cities of the low country, and of the south of Judah, and had taken Bethshemesh, and Ajalon, and Gederoth, and Shocho with the villages thereof, and Timnah with the villages thereof, Gimzo also and the villages thereof: and they dwelt there.
verses.web: The Philistines also had invaded the cities of the lowland, and of the South of Judah, and had taken Beth Shemesh, Aijalon, Gederoth, Soco with its villages, Timnah with its villages, and also Gimzo and its villages; and they lived there.
verses.ct: The Philistines had also raided the towns in the foothills and the southern region of Judah. They captured Beth Shemesh, Aijalon, Gederoth, Soco and its surrounding villages, Timnah and its villages, and Gimzo and its villages — and they settled in all of them.

verses.kjv: For the LORD brought Judah low because of Ahaz king of Israel; for he made Judah naked, and transgressed sore against the LORD.
verses.web: For LORD brought Judah low because of Ahaz king of Israel, because he acted without restraint in Judah and trespassed severely against LORD.
verses.ct: The LORD humbled Judah because of Ahaz king of Israel, who had thrown off all restraint in Judah and sinned terribly against the LORD.

verses.kjv: And Tilgathpilneser king of Assyria came unto him, and distressed him, but strengthened him not.
verses.web: Tilgath Pilneser king of Assyria came to him, and gave him trouble, but didn’t strengthen him.
verses.ct: Tilgath Pilneser king of Assyria did come to him, but instead of helping, he only made things worse.

verses.kjv: For Ahaz took away a portion out of the house of the LORD, and out of the house of the king, and of the princes, and gave it unto the king of Assyria: but he helped him not.
verses.web: For Ahaz took away a portion out of LORD’s house, and out of the house of the king and of the princes, and gave it to the king of Assyria; but it didn’t help him.
verses.ct: Ahaz stripped treasures from the LORD's temple, the royal palace, and the homes of his officials, and gave it all to the king of Assyria — but it did him no good.

verses.kjv: And in the time of his distress did he trespass yet more against the LORD: this is that king Ahaz.
verses.web: In the time of his distress, he trespassed yet more against LORD, this same king Ahaz.
verses.ct: Even in the middle of his troubles, King Ahaz sinned against the LORD even more.

verses.kjv: For he sacrificed unto the gods of Damascus, which smote him: and he said, Because the gods of the kings of Syria help them, therefore will I sacrifice to them, that they may help me. But they were the ruin of him, and of all Israel.
verses.web: For he sacrificed to the gods of Damascus, which struck him. He said, “Because the gods of the kings of Syria helped them, so I will sacrifice to them, that they may help me.” But they were the ruin of him, and of all Israel.
verses.ct: He offered sacrifices to the gods of Damascus, the very nation that had defeated him. He reasoned, "The gods of Syria's kings helped them win, so if I sacrifice to those gods, maybe they'll help me too." But those gods became his downfall — and the downfall of all Israel.

verses.kjv: And Ahaz gathered together the vessels of the house of God, and cut in pieces the vessels of the house of God, and shut up the doors of the house of the LORD, and he made him altars in every corner of Jerusalem.
verses.web: Ahaz gathered together the vessels of God’s house, and cut the vessels of God’s house in pieces, and shut up the doors of LORD’s house; and he made himself altars in every corner of Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Ahaz gathered up the sacred vessels from God's temple and smashed them to pieces. He shut the doors of the LORD's temple and built pagan altars on every street corner in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And in every several city of Judah he made high places to burn incense unto other gods, and provoked to anger the LORD God of his fathers.
verses.web: In every city of Judah he made high places to burn incense to other gods, and provoked LORD, the God of his fathers, to anger.
verses.ct: In every town throughout Judah, he set up high places to burn incense to foreign gods, provoking the LORD, the God of his ancestors, to anger.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of his acts and of all his ways, first and last, behold, they are written in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.
verses.web: Now the rest of his acts, and all his ways, first and last, behold, they are written in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.
verses.ct: Everything else about his reign, from beginning to end, is recorded in the official history of the kings of Judah and Israel.

verses.kjv: And Ahaz slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the city, even in Jerusalem: but they brought him not into the sepulchres of the kings of Israel: and Hezekiah his son reigned in his stead.
verses.web: Ahaz slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the city, even in Jerusalem, because they didn’t bring him into the tombs of the kings of Israel; and Hezekiah his son reigned in his place.
verses.ct: Ahaz died and was buried in Jerusalem, but they did not place him in the tombs of the kings of Israel. His son Hezekiah became king after him.
